casebody.data:
STATE EX REL. UTILITIES COMMISSION
v.
ATTORNEY GENERAL 271A18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. March 18, 2019 Margaret A. Force, Teresa L. Townsend, Assistant Attorney Generals, Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, Jennifer T. Harrod, Attorney at Law, James W. Doggett, Deputy Solicitor General, for Stein, Josh (Attorney General). Kiran H. Mehta, Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Molly Leigh McIntosh, Attorneys at Law, for Duke Energy Progress, LLC. Matthew D. Quinn, Attorney at Law, for Sierra Club. David T. Drooz, Lucy E. Edmondson, Staff Attorneys, for Public Staff - N.C. Utilities Commission. James P. West, Attorney at Law, for Fayetteville Public Works Commission. Kyle J. Smith, Attorney at Law, for Department of Defense/Federal Executive Agencies.

*883The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Brief filed on the 14th of March 2019 by Attorney General:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 18th of March 2019."

Attorney General shall have up to and including the 26th day of April 2019 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
